intro: Scurrula corynitis, commonly known as the yellow scurrilla, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers in umbel-like clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Scurrula corynitis is often found in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a valuable plant for ecological studies and habitat diversity.
